title: launch error 0xc000012f
body: I was trying to open the client I played league just yesterday without any problems. I try to load up the game and it came up with an error; 0xc000012f. I've never seen this before so I uninstalled and reinstalled league, download updates and it opens fine. I click on LAUNCH and it replays the error message again. why is this happening and how do I fix it? feeling like {{champion:32}} now :(

replies.body: Same problem here tried unistalling it but nothing works trying everything and cant play it now! Please help!

1.) Open "My Documents"
2.) On the left panel click "This Pc"
3.) Click now on the main menu "Local Disk C Drive" (That's where games usually auto install unless when you originally installed your league you moved it into a different drive in that case find that drive.)
4.) Open the "Riot Games" folder
5.) Open "League of Legends" folder
6.) Scroll down until you locate the file called "LeagueClient" this is where my fix works, if the symbol beside that file is an "X" or when you right click on the file and "Error" pops up then this WILL help you. If not I'm not entirely sure.
7.) DELETE THE "LEAGUECLIENT" FILE
8.) In the same folder, a few files down click "lol.launcher" and it should run the client.
9.) From the client hit the LAUNCH button and voila!
I love you bro thanks for your awesome REPLY !
Thanks man, actually working
Thank you very much i had this error today and this fixed it
Omg it actualy worked you are a life saver
I dont know why it worked but Thanks :)

> [{quoted}](name=Juul de plopkoek,realm=EUW,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=UtLr83Eu,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2017-07-10T16:38:58.142+0000)

> 2.) On the left panel click "This Pc"

> 6.) Scroll down until you locate the file called "LeagueClient" this is where my fix works, if the symbol beside that file is an "X" or when you right click on the file and "Error" pops up then this WILL help you. If not I'm not entirely sure.
> 7.) DELETE THE "LEAGUECLIENT" FILE
> 8.) In the same folder, a few files down click "lol.launcher" and it should run the client.
> 9.) From the client hit the LAUNCH button and voila!

thank you so much this was just the solution for me
I am having the same issue! Have tried some things already, including resetting my computer and updating my drivers and its still not working. :(  So frustrating.{{champion:131}}

> [{quoted}](name=imthatgirl,realm=OCE,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=UtLr83Eu,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-04-14T06:08:41.334+0000)
>
> I am having the same issue! Have tried some things already, including resetting my computer and updating my drivers and its still not working. :(  So frustrating.{{champion:131}}

Try deleting all residual files by searching for anything that includes "League" or "Riot" and deleting them as well as uninstalling League. Then run the LoL setup as admin and run the game as admin when it is reinstalled.
For anybody in the future who reads this thread, this method worked for me and saved me a lot of time.
Same problem :( {{champion:32}}
TNX :* {{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Love you so much :*{{sticker:katarina-love}} {{summoner:35}}
Thx dude!
same issue here as everyone else

Mine did the same thing. I had to reinstall the game. But I noticed that when I uninstalled the League of Legends that wasn't working, there was still a file in C drive named Riot Games which still contained a lot of files (including the ones that weren't working). I had to manually delete that folder, THEN re-install League of Legends and it worked fine. Not sure why it did it, but that is what fixed my issue
i am having the same issue! I don't know what i can do help me please riot!

The culprit here might be a security setting that's failing to locate a necessary file in order to launch.  To start, go over the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to help fix it up.  Dry those ears, I'm sure that will do the trick!

Nothing there helped me :(

Damn, thanks for trying though.  Hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) at this point so our tech team can take a closer look with you.

Download the [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) as well to grab some logs, and attach them to your ticket for context.  We'll get back to you!
